body_html:
I am not sure, our primary environment is ubuntu so I can only speculate.
It can be missing headers, or some confusion on bazel side when you have different gcc versions installed.
It may be as simple as setting some environment variables, or there may be bugs in Bazel itself.

As I mentioned before, our primary development environment is ubuntu, and we only provide official support on ubuntu. You may be able to get more information from the community on this issue.

body:
I am not sure, our primary environment is ubuntu so I can only speculate.
It can be missing headers, or some confusion on bazel side when you have different gcc versions installed.
It may be as simple as setting some environment variables, or there may be bugs in Bazel itself.

As I mentioned before, our primary development environment is ubuntu, and we only provide official support on ubuntu. You may be able to get more information from the community on this issue.
